Question.description: Represents a question within a quiz.

Assignment.title: Assignment
Assignment.description: Represents an assignment within a course.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Assignment entity.

dueDate.description: Due date and time for the assignment.

Progress.title: Progress
Progress.description: Represents a students progress in a course.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Progress entity.

assignmentCompletion.description: List of assignmentIds that the user has completed

Instructor.title: Instructor
Instructor.description: Represents an instructor who creates and manages courses.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Instructor entity.

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a chat message between users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChatMessage entity.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent.

AIInteraction.title: AIInteraction
AIInteraction.description: Represents an interaction with the AI tutoring assistant.

id.description: Unique identifier for the AIInteraction entity.

question.description: The question asked to the AI assistant.

courseId.description: Reference to the Course. (Relationship: Course 1:N AIInteraction). Optional as could be a general question.

Purchase.title: Purchase
Purchase.description: Represents a purchase of a product within the EdTech platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Purchase entity.

productId.description: Identifier for the product purchased. This could reference a Course or other digital asset.

purchaseDate.description: Date and time of the purchase.

price.description: Price of the product at the time of purchase.

Review.title: Review
Review.description: Represents a student's review of an instructor.

instructorId.description: The ID of the instructor being reviewed.

studentId.description: The ID of the student who wrote the review.

rating.description: The rating given by the student, typically from 1 to 5.

comment.description: The text content of the review.

date.description: The date the review was submitted.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes security and scalability for the EdTech platform, focusing on authorization independence and clear access patterns. It leverages path-based ownership for user-specific data and membership maps for collaborative data access, eliminating the need for `get()` calls in security rules and ensuring atomic operations.

The core principle is **Authorization Independence**. For the `/artifacts/{appId}/public/data/digital_purchases` collection, even though the data is 'public', security is maintained because each document contains the `userId`. Rules are structured to ensure only the authenticated user can create a purchase request for themselves. The `appId` parameter in the path allows for segregation and management of data within specific application contexts, which is useful for multi-tenant environments or different versions of the EdTech platform.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**
*   The structure supports secure `list` operations by segregating data into collections with homogeneous security postures. For example, purchase requests are stored in a dedicated collection `/artifacts/{appId}/public/data/digital_purchases`, where access is controlled based on the `userId` within each document, allowing for listing purchases securely.

**Denormalization**: The `userId` is denormalized into the `/artifacts/{appId}/public/data/digital_purchases` collection, where access control can depend directly on the attributes stored in the document. A new `/instructors/{instructorId}/reviews/{reviewId}` path is added for storing student reviews. This is publicly readable but writing is restricted to authenticated users to prevent spam.

**Explicit State Modeling:** The `Purchase` entity includes a `status` field to explicitly model the state of a purchase (e.g., 'Awaiting Payment', 'Completed', 'Refunded'). This avoids inferring state from multiple fields, enhancing clarity and simplifying security rules.
